stories.title: Apple Park: first look at the design team shaping the future of tech

stories.text: Hi, I guess this is just yet another instance of some content farm producing highly addictive videos. But go to Youtube (in private browsing mode) and search for Cake Stories, Cake Storytime or something similar. Hundreds of videos will appear that are all very similar. They are all timelaps videos of cakes/desserts being prepared while a young female voices tells a story about some high school drama, troubles with parents or some college incident. Has anybody else seen those and finds those troubling?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is YouTube being flooded by Cake+Story Videos?
Founding Team vs. Solo Founder, Which Is Better?
Can We Even Put Human Stories in Video Games Anyway?

stories.text:
Should pursue software engineering or product management roles?

I'm young and trying to make my next career move.

My first attempt at a mobile app startup just failed. I built the mobile app, as well as the AI-powered backend myself.

Now, I'm job hunting.

I have a Master's in Computer Science from a top CS school but zero years of experience as a software engineer (I do have a couple of years of systems engineering experience).

My end goal is to be a successful tech founder, playing the tech and product role.

I think I can build the MVP of low-medium difficult producst, albeit sloppily. But I think working as software engineer would legitimize me as a technical person moving forward and enable me to write scalable and reliable code. Technical co-founders seem more in-demand than product people.

However, I feel I have more to learn on the product side. I'm scared to remove myself from the technical side for too long and not be able to return. How important are years of experience as a software engineer to be a technical co-founder?
stories.title: Product management or software engineering for a founder hopeful?
